name: Alex Johnson
title: Senior Frontend Engineer | React + TypeScript | GraphQL & Data Visualization
description:
I am passionate about building frontend platforms that unlock productivity and deliver delightful, data-driven experiences. Over eight years I have designed and shipped scalable web applications with React and TypeScript, combining robust UI systems with thoughtful data visualization. I focus on building reusable component libraries, clean architecture, and reliable front-end foundations that scale with growing teams. I have delivered dashboards and analytics tools that present complex data clearly, enabling engineers and product stakeholders to measure impact and make informed decisions. My work often centers on integrating frontend experiences with GraphQL backends, shaping data models, and crafting responsive, accessible interfaces that meet WCAG standards. I strive to reduce latency, improve reliability, and shorten feedback loops through automated testing, instrumentation, and CI/CD. I have architected front-end solutions that expose clear, real-time insights into system performance and developer productivity, aligning with strategic goals and measurable outcomes.

Beyond hands-on development, I contribute to cross-functional product and design reviews, helping to scope, estimate, and prioritize features amid competing demands. I mentor junior engineers, advocate for best practices, and support the growth of early-career talent. I communicate clearly with stakeholders, translate user needs into actionable tasks, and drive initiatives with a product-minded, metrics-driven approach. I am comfortable operating in ambiguity, balancing quality, speed, and scope, and I frequently draft documentation for teams to onboard quickly to platforms and tools. My experience with GraphQL API layers and data models supports diverse front-end experiences, and I enjoy collaborating with frontend/UI engineers, designers, product managers, and users to understand needs and deliver high-impact solutions. I also take pride in building internal UI libraries and design systems to ensure consistency and accelerate delivery across projects, while maintaining a strong focus on accessibility, internationalization, and maintainability.

experiences.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
descriptions: Built reusable React components and UI libraries for internal applications; designed dashboards for internal analytics and real-time insights.
Optimized frontend performance, reducing load times by 30%.
Implemented automated testing (Jest, Cypress) and monitoring tools.
Developed interactive dashboards and data visualizations with TypeScript and React.
Collaborated with backend teams to expose GraphQL endpoints and ensure smooth data flow across services.
Contributed to design system evolution to support consistent UI across products.

experiences.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
descriptions: Led migration from legacy JavaScript to TypeScript and modern React architecture.
Integrated GraphQL APIs and optimized state management with Redux/RTK.
Ensured responsive, accessible, and user-friendly UI design following WCAG standards.
Introduced CI/CD pipelines for frontend deployments and automated testing.
Mentored junior engineers and contributed to team coaching and knowledge sharing.
Led cross-functional reviews to align requirements and scope with product and design teams.

experiences.title: Frontend Engineer
descriptions: Developed modular UI components with React, Styled Components, and Tailwind CSS.
Integrated third-party services, including payment gateways and analytics.
Improved maintainability via component standardization and code refactoring.
Implemented frontend monitoring, error tracking, and performance metrics.

experiences.title: Frontend Software Engineer
descriptions: Developed frontend and backend-for-frontend (BFF) with React, TypeScript, and Node.js.
Migrated REST APIs to GraphQL for more efficient data handling.
Applied micro-frontend architecture for modular development.
Implemented frontend metrics and performance monitoring dashboards.

experiences.title: Junior Frontend Engineer
descriptions: Developed lightweight web applications in Node.js and vanilla JavaScript.
Integrated IoT devices with web dashboards.
Adopted open-source frameworks and modern frontend practices.
